missionProperties.missionInfo:
{-} Doors are locked. <color="red">Luke Skywalker</color> can interact with the terminal to open all doors.
{-} Apply additional health to <color="red">Luke Skywalker</color> equal to twice the threat level.
{-} The mission will progress when the doors to the Garage are opened.
{-} The Rebels lose when <color="red">Luke Skywalker</color>is defeated.
missionProperties.startingObjective: Open the door the to Garage.
missionProperties.repositionOverride: Block access to the T-16 Skyhopper.

events.eventText:
You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

You receive a call from Luke when you draw near to his safe house. "Finally. I was starting to think no one would come."

Imperial forces swarm throughout the farmstead, and it seems your arrival is rather timely. 

''My transport is inside the garage," Luke tells you, waving to you through a window as you approach.

{-} Deploy the heroes to the blue highlighted space.
{-} Deploy <color="red">Luke Skywalker</color> (Hero of the Rebellion) to the red indicated space.
{-} Doors are locked. <color="red">Luke Skywalker</color> can interact with the terminal to open all doors.
{-} Apply additional health to <color="red">Luke Skywalker</color> equal to twice the threat level.
{-} The mission will progress when the doors to the Garage are opened.
{-} The Rebels lose when <color="red">Luke Skywalker</color>is defeated.

The T-16 rockets into the air, twisting and weaving to evade the fire of the ground forces. Eager to get off-world, you hurry back to your ship as a message comes through:

"Thanks, that was a close one," Luke says, relief in his voice. "I owe you one."

{-} The Rebels win the mission!
{-} Heroes receive <color="red">Luke Skywalker</color> (Hero of the Rebellion) as an ally.
{-} Each hero receives 1 XP. Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.

You're driven back by a hail of blaster fire, separating you from Luke. You are forcerd, to retreat, hoping desperately that Luke can make his own escape.

{-} The Rebels lose the mission.
{-} Each hero receives 1 XP. Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.
The doors to the garage slide open, revealing more than just Luke's T-16.

translatedEntityProperties.theText: This terminal controls the door lock mechanisms.

eventActions.tbText:
A squad of Imperial stormtroopers is deployed inside with blasters raised, ready and waiting to capture the Rebellion's hero. 

You see the terrifying outline of Darth Vader standing tall among the soldiers. With one hand he activates his lightsaber and with the other he points at you and Luke, indicating to his troops to begin their attack.

{-} The adjacent blocked spaces on the Garage form a T-16 Skyhopper. If there are 2 or fewer Imperial figures on the Garage, <color="red">Luke Skywalker</color> can interact with the T-16 to escape.
{-} The Rebels win when <color="red">Luke Skywalker</color> escapes.

eventActions.theText:
{-} Apply additional health to <color="red">Luke Skywalker</color> equal to twice the threat level.
{-} The adjacent blocked spaces on the Garage form a T-16 Skyhopper. If there are 2 or fewer Imperial figures on the Garage,  <color="red">Luke Skywalker</color> can interact with the T-16 to escape.
{-} The Rebels win when <color="red">Luke Skywalker</color> escapes.
{-} The Rebels lose when <color="red">Luke Skywalker</color>is defeated.

mapEntities.mainText: The door leads to the Garage. It is controlled by the terminal.
The door leads to the Garage. It is controlled by the terminal.
The door leads to the Garage. It is controlled by the terminal.

This terminal controls the door lock mechanisms.

<color="red">Luke Skywalker</color> can interact with the terminal to open all doors.

The T-16 Skyhopper is ready to start anytime.

If there are 2 or fewer Imperial figures on the Garage, <color="red">Luke Skywalker</color> can interact with the T-16 to escape.
